body:
When a module imports a declaration containing a ctuple from a pxd, the C declaration for the ctuple will be missing:

a.pyx:

```
cimport b
b.get_a_ctuple()
```

b.pxd:

```
cdef (int, int) get_a_ctuple()
```

The `__pyx_ctuple_int__and_int` struct and typedef will then be missing, while if `get_a_ctuple` had been declared in aâ€™s module (even in a pxd) it would have been fine.

Migrated from http://trac.cython.org/ticket/873

comment_data.body:
+1

I'd love to see this issue resolved!

Tests for additional failure cases are included in the PR, specifically:

* cimported typedef declaration including a ctuple
* cimported function with optional arguments including a ctuple
* cimported class method with ctuple argument

Is it ready for me to pull down and test on my code?

EDIT:
And thanks @isotherm!
Sure, please try it and report back. It works for my use case locally, and the tests pass. I do not believe there could be any adverse side effects.
Thanks for the report! I pushed a new commit, which adds a test for that case, and it also appears to work on your code. Please confirm that it works for you.

Thanks for the patch! I think that fixes the issue at hand, but there is another commit between yours and `bfcaf163e3dcf472ef2af5dec6ac3fffd0d34e66` which makes my code fail (calculating the checksum of a Game Boy cartridge) in runtime. I will hopefully have time to bisect that tomorrow.

I'm not sure if you want to make a PR and merge before I isolate that? It's likely unrelated to your code.

Great, thanks! I made a small modification to the patch to be more internally consistent. I do have PR https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3255 open, but I am awaiting feedback from @scoder or others if this is the correct approach.
I've isolated the commit to 6d9daa08142e8a61d1f098fa0039b642537e614c, so I would safely say that your code is not causing the issue. This is an isolated optimization of the `&` operator.

title: cimported ctuples donâ€™t compile their declaration
